description:
Currently this just creates the admin user for standalone deployments using the
 default user service adapter. It must be called once after candlepin is installed,
 repeat calls are not required, but will be harmless.
summary: Initialize the Candlepin database.
returns: Description if db was or already is initialized.

description:
If a pool ID is specified, we know we're binding to that exact pool. Specifying
 an entitle date in this case makes no sense and will throw an error.
summary: Request an entitlement.
returns:
Response with a list of entitlements or if async is true, a
         JobDetail.

summary:
Create a Consumer. NOTE: Opening this method up to everyone, as we have
 nothing we can reliably verify in the method signature. Instead we have
 to figure out what owner this consumer is destined for (due to backward
 compatability with existing clients which do not specify an owner during
 registration), and then check the access to the specified owner in the
 method itself.
delete the consumer.

description:
This is a dry run of an autobind. It allows the client to see what would be the
 result of an autobind without executing it. It can only do this for the prevously
 established list of installed products for the consumer
summary: Request a list of pools and quantities that would result in an actual auto-bind.
returns: Response with a list of PoolQuantities containing the pool and number.

summary: Return the compliance status of the specified consumer.
returns: the compliance status by the given uuid.

summary: Return the consumer identified by the given uuid.
returns: the consumer identified by the given uuid.

summary:
Return the client certificate metadatthat a for the given consumer. This
 is a small subset of data clients can use to determine which certificates
 they need to update/fetch.
returns: list of the client certificate metadata for the given consumer.

summary: Return the entitlement certificate for the given consumer.
returns: list of the client certificates for the given consumer.

description:
WARNING: this will delete all consumers in the environment and revoke their
 entitlement certificates.
summary: Delete an environment.

description:
Consumer's registered to this environment will no see this content in their
 entitlement certificates. (after they are regenerated and synced to clients)
summary: Demote content from an environment.
List all environments on the server. Only available to super admins.

description:
This call accepts multiple content sets to promote at once, after which
 all affected certificates for consumers in the enironment will be
 regenerated.
summary: Promote content into an environment.

Allows agents such as virt-who to update its host list and associate the
 guests for each host. This is typically used when a host is unable to
 register to candlepin via subscription manager.

summary:
Starts an asynchronous healing for the given Owner. At the end of the
 process the idea is that all of the consumers in the owned by the Owner
 will be up to date.
returns: the status of the pending job

summary: Return list of Owners.

summary:
'Tickle' an owner to have all of their entitlement pools synced with
 their subscriptions. This method (and the one below may not be entirely
 RESTful, as the updated data is not supplied as an argument.
returns: the status of the pending job

description:
This call does not differentiate between any specific import, it just
 destroys all subscriptions with an upstream pool ID, essentially anything from
 an import. Custom subscriptions will be left alone.
summary:
Cleans out all imported subscriptions and triggers a background refresh pools.
 Link to an upstream distributor is removed for the owner, so they can import from
 another distributor. Other owners can also now import the manifests originally
 used in this owner.
returns: the status of the pending job

description: To un-set the defaultServiceLevel for an owner, submit an empty string.
summary: Update an owner.

description:
To avoid race conditions, we do not support updating the user or permission
 collections. Currently this call will only update the role name.
